name: The White House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the White House hotel.The hotel is charming and the staff and owners cannot do enough to make your stay as relaxing and pleasant as possible.The rooms are very comfortable , the bed so comfortable we almost overslept and missed breakfast!
reviews.title: very relaxing , excellent food and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast and dinners are fantastic, which clearly explains why so many awards have been won by the chef.(Eggs- fresh that morning from the chickens owned by the hotel) .I particularly liked the fact that all the food served in the restaurant is sourced from local suppliers.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Restaurant

likes.liked: — Great room, the bath is fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone that likes a hotel that offers fantastic service , is welcoming , and will do everything they can to make your stay enjoyabe
reviews.title: great duck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The White House is a superb, small hotel in the village of Charmouth just a very short walk from the beach. The weekend visit got off to a great start with a warm welcome from Ian at the door making us feel very welcome. The (Premier) room we stayed in was first class, the breakfast and evening meal were both excellent and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. It's easy to understand why this hotel has so many awards for service and good quality locally sourced food produce.
reviews.title: A real gem

likes.liked: — Quality of accommodation, service and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a great place to stay, thoroughly recommended !!
reviews.title: Loved the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have recently returned from a short break at the White House. We were welcomed on arrival by Liz with the offer of tea and biscuits. We stayed in the Superior room and had no complaints - very clean, nicely furnished with views across to the church and the hills.
reviews.title: Super hotel with very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is elegant, set on one of the main roads in Charmouth but not noisy. Our one reservation about position was the "interesting" narrow entrance to the car park at the rear of the building which could be tricky if you have a large car.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, very friendly, excellent service

reviews.text: The staff were very attentive and friendly. The food was excellent with a good choice both for breakfast and for dinner - usually 3 starters, 3 main courses and about 6 desserts plus cheese. Ian is a talented chef and we enjoyed everything.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought the hotel was a real find and we hope to return one day.
reviews.title: Poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a short break at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The building is lovely with lots of original features; we had a beautiful room with a fantastic large bath and everything we needed. The breakfasts were delicious and included a range of local produce. The owners could not have been more accomodating- thank you!
reviews.title: Relaxing and delicious stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just come back from a wonderful stay at the White House. The husband & wife team could not have been more frriendly and helpful, the food was fantastic, all locally sourced, the room was comfortable with a beautiful view of the little church opposite, in all, the perfect short break!
reviews.title: This hotel deserves 11 out of 10!

reviews.text: having read the favourable reviews about this hotel I have to say we were slightly disappointed with it
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about this hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it is not a cheap place to stay, and our breakfasts and room standards did vary
reviews.title: A break from London

reviews.text: my friends room was pleasant, mine was slightly musty smelling, and being on the ground floor, not really very secure with the window left open to air it (it also could benefit from a net curtain at both windows for privacy!)
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my friends bathroom was good, mine a little less spacious, and trying to stand back from the shower in the small cubicle, impossible
reviews.title: Great local food,lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every effort is made by this family-run hotel to make your stay special. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the beds are comfortable. Unfortunately, we booked only the day before, so we were given a smaller standard room, but at the cost of many B & B's (£90 for the room) we weren't complaining. Breakfast was excellent, and we heard from other guests that the award-winning evening meals (at £34 a head) were superb. The television remote control and clock-radio were not in evidence, but this was quickly rectified by the helpful manager. As for the moaner who tried to get a discount because of the noise of revellers, well, yes, particularly the front rooms will pick up sounds from the street, but Charmouth is a very quiet place and the hotel is well set back from the road. This is definitely a good place to stay if wishing to explore the Dorest coast.
reviews.title: Every effort made to make stay special
an unespected oasias
reviews.text: after an unexpected visit to charmouth we arrived at this hotel,

aka: The White House Hotel Charmouth, Dorset
description: Lovely four bedroomed Regency house in the centre of the coastal Village of Charmouth in West Dorset, right at the heart of the World Heritage Jurassic CoastlineOwned and run by Chef Ian Simpson and his wife Elizabeth since 2001 The White House has been totally refurbished to a high standard in the winter of 2012/3 and was subsequently awarded FOUR GOLD STARS from the AA as well as a Breakfast and Dinner Award.Winners of Taste of the West Gold Awards for 2013 in Restaurant and B&BFinalists in the 2013 Dorset Tourism Awards B&B category.
